observations: The grid is divided into horizontal bands.
The top, middle, and bottom bands remain unchanged.
Other bands copy values from positions in different columns within the same row.
Certain values get propagated horizontally within each row.
Rows consisting entirely of a single digit remain unchanged.
The middle row of ones is unaffected.
The first and last two rows do not change.
The propagation only happens in rows with a mix of digits.
hypotheses: Propagate values horizontally within rows, replacing certain digits based on others in the same row.
If a row contains value 'A' at column x and value 'B' at column y, then replace intermediate values in columns between x and y with 'B'.
In rows not consisting of all ones or all the same number, replace the zero values between non-zero values with the non-zero values.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Copy numbers from adjacent cells, overwriting only zeroes.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In Example 1, the value 2 is inserted even where there were non-zero numbers.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Replace the value between two different numbers with the right number
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Example 3 shows that '3' overwrites '0', but '2' overwrites '0' as well, suggesting the right number may spread to intermediate locations only when intermediate locations are zeroes.

selected_rule: In rows that do not consist of all ones or all of the same number, fill the zeros between nonzero values with the value of the closest nonzero value.
step_plan: For each row, check if all the values are the same, or all are ones.
If the values are all ones or all the same, copy the row from the input to the output.
Otherwise, for each zero in the row, replace it with the closest non-zero number on its left or right.
